text:
Hi, I just want to inform you that I made it, but not over UTMs, because it didn't show any results. I did it over Latest Source Drill down1. It shows complete URL.
Thanks again for help.

Best,

I’ve just noticed a breaking change in my portal
My {% require_js %} files are appearing in the footer by default (They used to appear in the header as per the docs)
(I can obviously just add position=“head” but I feel like tags shouldn’t just break like that)
Hi everyone, I have a quick question about headers. is there any way to customize headers of a request ?

do you mean this stuff in domain settings?
HubSpot allows you to do these but not sure about your own headers.
if it’s serverless functions that’s something else, not to sure though
I'm not exactly sure, Last week I saw a small demo of the program and it looked like there was a tab that let you customize the headers of the request created by encountering a subscribed event.
Sorry not sure what direction I can point you in
No worries, thank you for your time!

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Thank you for the insight into this.  We will take a further look at what you have suggested.  It would seem that Content Staging might be the best bet.

Still working through the learning curve of HubSpot as we have inherited this from a SI which kind of left us on our own.

Hi everyone, I'm having issues with HubSpot live chat being embedded in an iframe. We have extension which is calling our react app inside iframe , and also we have mobile app which is calling our react app inside WebView, and in both places the HubSpot live chat script isn't being loaded. Does HubSpot work with nested iframe?
If you're looking for help - I'll be happy to discuss a potential cooperation/guidance/help since I'm a Solution Provider who's focusing on HubSpot CMS(Content Hub) development and Design

Hey <@U07GWEYDKFV> -
A few thoughts, not sure if any of this is relevant, but hope this helps!
1. The Conversations widget requires the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/install-the-HubSpot-tracking-code|HubSpot Tracking code> to load (unless you're using the mobile SDK, mentioned below), so a webview would need to load a page that fires the tracking code, and then can load the widget. Widget load is controlled by URL or query params (i.e. "load on this page with this URL or param)
2. There's a Conversations SDK that gives you some control using JS to load the widget - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/conversations/chat-widget-sdk>
3. If you're in a mobile app, there's a Chat mobile SDK (both iOS and Android are available) - <https://github.com/HubSpot/mobile-chat-sdk-ios>
4. I have this video from a few years ago that shows using the Conversations JS SDK on a page, that is then loaded in a webview in iOS. <https://www.loom.com/share/dca294a8a02c4ce684da02fc10bd81a2?sid=dea79abe-ed4d-40a1-8654-f97c178f056e>
give some of this a shot and let me know if you're successful or hit any challenges
